column4: hello, after changing my kernel to 3.2.12 all boot logos, for starting, and shutdown/reboot, are just gone how i restore that?
lol, why anudaasa? everyting is working, less the ubuntu logo from booting :P
sounds like your framebuffer driver is missing from your 3.2 kernel
edit /etc/default/grub. Change the "GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT" to have "nomodeset" then add "GRUB_GFXPAYLOAD_LINUX=text" to the end of the file. Then run Update grub
